samples.context: Human beings are complex animals and hence there is a distinct phase in their life cycle which marks the onset and attainment of sexual maturity.
samples.question: What marks the onset of sexual maturity?

samples.context: This period is called puberty. It usually starts at around 10 – 11 years of age in girls and at around 12 – 13 years of age in boys.
samples.question: What is the starting age of puberty in boys?

samples.context: It usually ends at around 18th year of age in girls and at around 19th year of age in boys.
samples.question: At what age does puberty end for girls?

samples.context: Since the years during puberty end in ‘teens’; hence this phase is also called teenage.
samples.question: Why is puberty also called teenage?

samples.context: This period is called puberty. It usually starts at around 10 – 11 years of age in girls and at around 12 – 13 years of age in boys.
samples.question: What is the general age range for girls to start puberty?
